title: 30 Years Ago: STS-64 Astronauts Test a Spacewalk Rescue Aid

title: Kyle Helson Finds EXCITE-ment in Exoplanet Exploration
summary: Almost a decade ago, then-grad student Kyle Helson contributed to early paperwork for NASA’s EXCITE mission. As a scientist at Goddard, Helson helped make this balloon-based telescope a reality: EXCITE launched successfully on Aug. 31. Name: Kyle HelsonTitle: Assistant Research ScientistOrganization: Observational Cosmology Lab (Code 665), via UMBC and the GESTAR II cooperative agreement with […]

title: U.S. Space Force seeks industry input on automating hybrid satellite networks
summary: The Space Force's Commercial Satellite Communications Office issued a request for information on automated satcom network orchestration

title: A look back at Sentinel-2C's ride into space on Vega
summary: The third Copernicus Sentinel-2 satellite, Sentinel-2C, has launched aboard the last Vega rocket, flight VV24, from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana. The rocket lifted off on 5 September at 03:50 CEST (4 September 22:50 local time). Sentinel-2C will provide high-resolution data that is essential to Copernicus – the Earth observation component of the European Union’s Space programme. Developed, built and operated by ESA, the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission provides high-resolution optical imagery for a wide range of applications including land, water and atmospheric monitoring.

title: Boeing plots 2026 quantum networking satellite demo
summary: Boeing plans to deploy a small satellite in 2026 to test technology needed for a quantum internet capable of connecting more advanced sensors and computers worldwide, the company announced Sept. 10.
